website_summaries.verdict: Apple's slim, light, wireless Magic Keyboard gets a makeover, bringing back the number pad previously found in the old wired version. But it also costs more, so the standard Magic Keyboard may be better for you.
pros: The Apple Magic Keyboard with Numeric Keypad has light, bouncy keys that are great to type with
The new number pad makes it easier to input figures or work with some creative software shortcuts
It pairs easily and lasts a long time between charges
cons: The flat design can put strain on your wrist
The lack of backlight makes it harder to work with the keys at night

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard if you make a "slight" modification!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace the original bluetooth keyboard that came with my iMac about 4 years ago. This keyboard would be a 5-star IF it didn't lay perfectly flat. It has no flip-up legs to give an angle more comfortable and less strain on the carpal tunnel. I have attacked a 1/4" diameter wood dowel to the bottom to give it a small lift (see photo). It now is almost level with my existing 4 year old trackpad. I suggest this simple fix to solve the only shortcoming that I see. Perhaps Apple will see this review and update the keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Harry H.

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works
customer_reviews.text: It works 99% of the time. But the 1% is terribly frustrating. It will often drop connection without warning, sometimes permanently so I'll have to re-connect the Lightning cable and try pair it again to my MBP over and over (or wait 10 minutes). The worst is when it freaks out and dies while typing, sending a stuck loop of characters over and over to the computer resulting in lines of text everywhere, cascading window-closing, and/or repeated menu commands. I wish I could say this was unusual for Apple, but with their myopic approach to quality it's unlikely anything other than the iPhone / iPad will every be "Pro" again. (Maybe that's why they switched to "Magic?")
customer_reviews.author: Radley

customer_reviews.title: but I like the feel
customer_reviews.text: The key action is a bit flat, but I like the feel. I tried a few cheaper keyboards that aren't Mac specific and ended up getting this. It is nice that it integrates so well with Mac OS, including showing the remaining battery level, all the keys working as expected, and so on. I've had issues with Bluetooth devices in the past but this always connects to my laptop. Note: when my MacBook Pro is closed and plugged into a monitor, and I press a key on the Magic Keyboard, it wakes the laptop up. Just wanted to throw that out there for anyone curious.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Space Gray MacBook Pro home peripheral
customer_reviews.text: Though I don't *love* this keyboard to death, the rating is to partially help offset the inappropriate 1-star whose issue should've been addressed with the seller. I ordered a US layout and received exactly that from a reputable seller. After trying some other brands, I always go back to the first party accessories. The story is no different here. Apple usually makes the best stuff for their own ecosystem. The look and feel of this fits the MacBook Pro design (introduced in 2016) perfectly. You can also get a Magic Trackpad in gray to match. But avoid the "Magic Mouse". That thing still sucks.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Where's the magic?
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. Feels like you are typing on thin sheets of cheap plastic, exactly the way it looks. Apple used to design and build high quality, innovative keyboards. Those days are long gone, now it's all about how cheaply they can manufacture their products to maintain the huge profit margins they have always been accustomed to. I hope Amazon has enough honesty to publish this review, they yanked the last one.
customer_reviews.author: js

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new MacBook Pro and had an old universal (Mac or PC) wireless keyboard that I was using with it. The keys didn’t work the same so I finally broke down and bought the Apple keyboard. While it is crazy expensive, the quality is fantastic and the battery lasts forever. I’m glad I made the purchase. Also, it’s $10 cheaper on Amazon than Apple and you get next day delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Mikara

customer_reviews.title: Getting Carpal Tunnel just looking at it.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BE FOOLED - this keyboard is flat as flat as a pancake. HELLO APPLE - super bad design - returning the second it came out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Great product with a solid feel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my girlfriend as a part of her desktop setup and it has performed flawlessly. I am a PC man myself, but Apple's products are always of extremely high quality and this one is no different. The battery holds charge and uses very little power to function, and the key travel and response is very satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Walker

customer_reviews.title: Completely BIASED Review
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Apple products since 1995 and am very immersed in the Apple ecosystem. Why? Quality. I know that when I purchase something, like this keyboard, I will be using it for many years to come. Since the invention of this style keyboard (2007?), I've only had to replace once prior to going wireless (2018, long after the wireless keyboard came out.) I did purchase a cheaper bluetooth keyboard once about a year ago but only to return it. it was light and slid around too much. Consequently, that cheaper keyboard made me appreciate the weight of the Apple keyboard that does stay in place until I intentionally move it.
customer_reviews.author: robomacman

customer_reviews.title: It's fine, but nothing more than just fine.
customer_reviews.text: It's an OK keyboard, nothing special. The keys wobble like crazy which makes the build quality seems fairly cheap. I would have given it a higher star rating, but the fact that Apple charges $150 for this average keyboard is just insulting, because it is nowhere near worth that price, hence the 2/5. The only thing keeping me from giving it a 1/5 is the fact that I think it looks decent in space grey, but honestly, there are lots of other space grey keyboards out there for a small fraction of this price. I do not recommend purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Poor thing was just plain bent
customer_reviews.text: After about a week of use, I noticed that the keyboard seemed to be sagging through the middle portion. Not yet enough to wobble, but almost making the aluminum touch the top of my desk. Looking "down the barrel", it was clear that the side edges were not in line with the center portion. Being an applephile, I thought Sir Jony had for some ingenious reason intended to bring the edges closer to my little fingers, but not this time. Poor thing was just plain bent. I re-read the reviews and found I was not the first to encounter this problem.
customer_reviews.author: DjangOH

customer_reviews.title: Fake Product
customer_reviews.text: Please beware! I bought this item on June 30, 2019 and today is August 8, 2019. One of the keys began to get sticky so I decided to set up an appointment and possibly get it fixed but the serial number on the keyboard is invalid! Meaning this item may be a knock off but I must admit a very very good one.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I don't think this is an authentic apple product
customer_reviews.text: I don't think this is an authentic apple product, I think it's a fake. If it is apple it's absolute garbage. I've had several of these style apple bluetooth keyboards in the past, this is nothing like them. They keys stick, it's impossible to touch type on this keyboard and the battery life is not consistent. I should have sent this back but I didn't open it for for over a month. This keyboard is a piece of junk, it's going in the trash as soon as I find a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Frater Asomatous

customer_reviews.title: Poor design and erratic behavior
customer_reviews.text: I should have learned from the reviews on Apple and Amazon site. Apple makes some great products but a lot of their accessories fall short. It seems like their focus is styling over functionality. I usually work with the keyboard in my lap and there no place to rest your hands. There is very little separation from space and the first row of keys and too often I hit a key and the space bar simultaneously. It also acts up, I'll get continuous repeated key strokes and other bizarre behavior. It's definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: mtb

customer_reviews.title: Heads up!!! Keysstick!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly. Seeabove. Or here! The space barhasstopped functioning reliably after sixmonths (bought on April20 2019-died Oct 20) A as a writer, an erratic spacebar (andIsuspect other keys willgo aswell), is abummer. A calltoApple was, you guessed it, another round of bringitinand we'll see what if it canbe repaired. Like Ihave endless hours to spend waiting for a headscratch anda shrug.For a priceybitof hardware you'd think you'dget at least a yearr. What a naif! Save yourself. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Annabwylde

customer_reviews.title: Printed characters on keys difficult to see.
customer_reviews.text: The printed letters and characters on the keys are so light that I have a hard time making out the letter. Apple needs to make the character color darker for a better contrast with the keys. I am sure the keyboard works just fine, but it doesn’t matter if you have to squint at the board. So if you are not a pro typist that doesn’t need to look at the keyboard, I’d give this one a second thought. I sent mine back and got Satechi.
customer_reviews.author: BhamMan

customer_reviews.title: Compatibility Warning - Check your OS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this keyboard. Feels and looks great. Pairing it to my iMac was easy. However, i realized within a few days that the volume keys don't work (F11 and F12). I did some research and realized that this keyboard is only compatible with OS X 10.12.4 or later. My mid-2011 iMac cannot be upgraded that high. So...it's going back. Note that the smaller version of this keyboard - without the numeric keypad - is compatible with OSX 10.11 or later (El Capitan). Seems pretty stupid that Apple would limit this keyboard like this. It's obvious they are able to make it work with older OS, since the small one does. Anyway, Buyer Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Singer

customer_reviews.title: Very well made but, not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a wired Apple 10-key keyboard for years now and thought that it was time for an upgrade that would also clear the wire off of my desk. The keyboard is very well made, it being an Apple product. The bluetooth works flawlessly and the battery life was impressive. What made me send it back after 2 weeks was the loss of tactile feel in the keys. It was like typing on a printout of a keyboard. It's purely subjective and I don't fault the product designers. It just isn't what I was looking for in a keyboard. If you're cool with that then it's a great keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Casey L

customer_reviews.title: Not pretty enough
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with the look. I expect Apple product to be high quality and aesthitic, but the keyboard does not meet my excitation. The white keys look like cheap plastic. The material doesn’t match either MacBook or Magic Mouse. The entire setting just look like each item came from different manufacturers. functional wise, it is good. Connection is stable. Battery drains very slow. But again, it’s Apple, so appearance is very important
customer_reviews.author: yellowelong

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but the best there is.
customer_reviews.text: As always, Apple gets everything right except keyboards. If you're a software engineer, the post-2018 "super thin" keyboards with tiny arrow keys and a mis-placed touchbar ESC key are just awful: welcome to carpal tunnel land. This keyboard has a more traditional key sizing, spacing, and travel, as well as full sized arrow keys - which is great. But not everybody needs a full number pad, which makes this keyboard HUGE on a desk. What we really need is a good keyboard with full-sized arrow and ESC keys but without a number pad. Sadly, Apple doesn't make one of those... Because they know best, right?
customer_reviews.author: C. RobinsonTop Contributor: Archery

customer_reviews.title: I tried a few other keyboards, but finally  broke down and paid for the Apple
customer_reviews.text: A solid, functional, efficient keyboard is very important to me. I had a brand I used for many years, but the company stopped supporting the Bluetooth functionality on a Mac. I discovered that some 3rd-party manufacturers play fast and loose with the keyboard layout - often repositioning or reducing the size of critical command keys. I was very resistant to buy an Apple keyboard because they are ridiculously expensive. But I broke down because I wanted a consistent experience between my MacBook Pro and iMac - the same finger placement for both means fewer mistakes. Still, the price was more than double that of most other keyboards. That's why I take away a star.
customer_reviews.author: David S. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: IT IS SO LIGHT!!
customer_reviews.text: I held off on buying a keyboard to use with my MacBook Pro for 10 years now. I am so surprised how light weight this keyboard is--almost feels like a feather. At the same time the metal encasing and the keys themselves make the entire product feel extremely durable, despite the impression that the weight may give. The rubber feet on the bottom are excellent in holding the laptop in place on a surface. Battery life is insane; the percentage listed in my bluetooth menu has yet to budge. Also, it comes with a black lightning/charger cable--until now I thought Apple only made these cables in white! [NOTE: I bought the MagicMouse 2 in addition to this keyboard.]
customer_reviews.author: M. Spector

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, slim and sleek like other Apple products
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard has a great feel to it just like previous Apple keyboards. The travel is moderate, not super short like the newer macbook keyboards. The soft clicking sound is very nice and not too loud. Battery life is great so far, currently I have been using the keyboard for over a month of heavy usage and still have 75% battery life without a recharge. The space gray color is very sleek and fits well with the rest of my computer accessories.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard layout, but it needs some flip out feet to keep it from laying flat.
customer_reviews.text: I was so glad to see that apple had build a rechargable keyboard with a number pad... popped for it straightaway. My only dissapointment was that it has nothing to hold the back of it up off of the desk. My solution was to stick some rubber adhesive blocks under the back, problem solved...but they really should have done that from the factory or just put some 7 degree flip out feet.
customer_reviews.author: WB5MGR

customer_reviews.title: Battery is great!  But be kind to your keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but worth it if just for the battery. During COVID I’ve been using my home computer for 8 hours a day. I only recharge once a month. I owned a used one before I purchased this one but I spilled wax on my old one. Uh...don’t spill wax on your keyboard. Don’t ask me what I was doing when I spilled the wax on the keyboard. Use your imagination.
customer_reviews.author: Jarod T. Okano

customer_reviews.title: Well-made Apple quality. I had the original wired keyboard ...
customer_reviews.text: Well-made Apple quality. I had the original wired keyboard with "classic" keys/switches from about 2015 or so. The new keyboard is thinner and I've found the lower profile keys actually help me to type faster. Just took about 1 day to get used to. From other reviews, I noticed there was some concern about bending in the middle of the keyboard. Please note, the keyboard is clearly DESIGNED to be very, very slightly concave, it is not perfectly flat across the top/key pad. Yes, the keyboard does lay very flat to the deck surface, it is not elevated in the back. I've personally found this helps keep the wrists in a neutral position and again, helps with typing speed.
customer_reviews.author: Floor Matt

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I got this because it was rechargeable and had the numeric key pad and other function buttons. The rechargeable battery goes for weeks/months without recharging. I am down to 48% power and its been three weeks since the last and only recharge since I bought it. The bluetooth connection is good. I have never lost connection. I have had it about 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from non-numeric keypad version
customer_reviews.text: I've been on the Mac since the early '90s, and for the most part, have always had a keyboard with a numeric keypad. For the last couple of years, Apple's shipped its iMacs with a non-numeric keyboard, so this upgrade is a throwback to my comfort zone and a most welcome addition. I bought it as an Amazon Warehouse deal, and it is working perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: ThinkmanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I found this.
customer_reviews.text: I encountered a bizarre inaction on my old Apple wireless keyboard when I pressed "return" and nothing happened. Same thing with the letter "p" and the question mark. What to do? Buy a cheaper wireless keyboard and cross my fingers? No. The stakes are too high: the replacement keyboard had be THE RIGHT ONE. And I did not want a "reconditioned" version of my original ... too risky. Well, this product is the solution. Also, it arrived incredibly quickly. Thankfully, because I really needed it. The keys feel the same as the original, and it's just pretty darn sleek.
customer_reviews.author: Blanche de Navarre

customer_reviews.title: 10-Key is not correct
customer_reviews.text: I have a PC at the office, and wanted a 10-key keyboard when working from home on my mac. The 10 key on this keyboard is not the standard used by the rest of the world (i.e. PC keyboards). I know Mac likes to do things their way, but REALLY. Why couldn't this just be the same. I might return the keyboard. Stupid Apple...
customer_reviews.author: B. Gallaher

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not perfect (for me)
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is nice but as soon as a space gray small version (without keypad) is available, I’ll be buying that. I’m finding I rarely use the keypad and would prefer my mouse be closer to the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: CMH

customer_reviews.title: Black, not White
customer_reviews.text: I just received this keyboard and it's not white. I don't see anything in the listing that says it's black so that's lame. I'm returning.
customer_reviews.author: Rjtravis

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard, but know that you do need mac os 10.12.4 or later for 100% functionality.
customer_reviews.text: Nice keyboard. I love the extra size and the number pad, but know that you need mac os 10.12.4 or later for 100% functionality. If not most of the function keys (top row on the board) will not work. I have an older iMac. OS 10.11.6 is as high as it will allow so I have only about 80% functionality. It's not a huge deal for me. I use and do like the keyboard. Despite the loss of keyboard functionality there are mouse and or menu workarounds so I can still do most of what I need to do.
customer_reviews.author: T. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Price!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard may seem expensive but I love the typing experience. The bluetooth pairing was super easy, too. Just plug in the USB/lightning cable and it's immediately paired. No need to go in to settings, etc. The space grey looks real sleek and is a nice fit depending on your room tone. The keyboard is high quality (Apple luxury, of course) and I'm a huge fan of how smooth the typing is. I don't have any regrets with this purchase. I'm also coming from the Apple keyboard from 2010... so the upgrade is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Murray 'DJ Unprotected'

customer_reviews.title: Takes some getting used to as anything else in life however your able to be more efficient.
customer_reviews.text: I like this because its the same as the new keyboard design and doesn't have the regular keyboard flaw where the up/down arrows are half the size. If your used to the old version one magic keyboard that was raised, I was too, however after a month or so of getting used to it, you can actually type much quicker than the older keyboard. Of course some people can't adopt to this, but I was surely able to. I must admit though the original non numeric keyboard that came with my 2017 iMac has an issue with the up/down arrow which this fixes, plus the numeric keys comes very handy.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Somehow even better than wired
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted a wired Apple (full) keyboard but they’ve stopped making them. I got a used one but it had a broken key. In the end, I decided to bite the bullet and get a new Magic Keyboard - I’m so glad I did. I’ve had it over a month and batteries are still over 85%. I didn’t think the cord bugged me before, but I really love not having one on my desk cluttering things up (same with the wireless trackpad). It is very solidly built and feels great to type on. Overall, this feels like a great buy for the long term!
customer_reviews.author: El Duderino

customer_reviews.title: Can't really get much better than this for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a pretty decent product for the given price point.
customer_reviews.author: Land

customer_reviews.title: Nice touch, keys a bit too flat.
customer_reviews.text: Not as ergonomic as my previous one. The keys are flat, unlike my MacAlly, so it is harder to keep fingers in place, especially if you are a fast typer like me. Otherwise, it has a very responsive touch.
customer_reviews.author: BeckaroosBooksEtc on eBay

customer_reviews.title: 10-key offered now in Wireless
customer_reviews.text: My previous apple keyboard was 10-key but was only offered in the wired variety. For some reason it kicked the bucket and would not work at all. This wireless version of that keyboard works great and the battery life is excellent. You cannot go wrong with this keyboard if it is compatible with your device.
customer_reviews.author: Nick in Portland

customer_reviews.title: It's great
customer_reviews.text: It's rather thin, but no complaints. If you need a large plushy keyboard, this is certainly not it, but I'm sure that's not why you selected one of Apple's best-known products. Anyway, I see these used and rather abused all the time at many a tech school and workplace and they continue to withstand the tests of time.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Williams

customer_reviews.title: It’s Magic
customer_reviews.text: It is magic, I unfortunately have to use Windows products at work, I’m an Apple user at home. This unit connect effortlessly with Windows 10, by simply selecting the keyboard from the Bluetooth menu, and your good to go! Keys are quiet( sorry loyd types) the keyboard is light and longer than the typical keyboard with number pad! I had a knock off this product and it died within 6 months so the Apple product is worth the extra $
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: A versatile, comfortable keyboard to have.
customer_reviews.text: The new keyboard was for my wife. She was limited by the shorter keyboard that accompanied her new computer. Her communications often require the use of several numbers, and being more adept at typing out numbers on a numeric keyboard than hunting them across the top of the keyboard, she was quite pleased with it. She also stated that the "home" and "end" keys, missing on the abbreviated keyboard are very handy. So... happy wife... happy life. And, the rechargeable bluetooth keyboard is a super bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick K. Hidy

customer_reviews.title: Keys too recessed and lays too flat
customer_reviews.text: Bummer! I was so excited for this---finally a wireless magic keyboard with a keypad. I was waiting for my old keyboard to fail and it finally did so I bought this. Really disappointed. The keys are too recessed into the keyboard body and the pitch is too flat---ie the keyboard doesn't tilt up enough so it sits really flat which I guess some people like but I find the whole feel really annoying to type on. Typing is kind of an important part of liking a keyboard. Typing on it for me was awful. Sticking with the old apple keyboard and separate wireless keypad by LMP. Bummer---I wanted to like this!
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you love apple keyboards, and need a wireless setup.
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with the newer style Apple keyboards. I used to use them wired, because the previously wireless versions were those tiny ones without the numeric keypad. I really dont like dinky keyboards, so i opted for wired. I was just browsing and saw that this full sized keyboard is now available wirelessly! As far as the keyboard itself, its everything id hoped for. Its super high quality, and feels, might i say, even sturdier than the wired versions. this is a must have if you love the apple keyboards like me.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: its apple it should be better
customer_reviews.text: this should work better then it does i would much rather have my corded key board back IT DIED i tried this one DONT it does work and I leave it plugged in and it will still not connect? for a second or two no big deal really just WHY? also no stand or feet what ever you want to call them this thing lays all but flat if you just want a key board keep looking I though APPLE it will be good not so much I mean the key board works fine (besides loosing connection) but there has to be better ones out there LIKE the keyboard that came with my iMac
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OBSESSED
customer_reviews.text: Truly I am obsessed with this keyboard, it connects to both my MAC and my PC desktop (not at the same time though). and its lightweight but feel truly qualilty in its design and structure. I wish I would find a cover for it for when I travel. Everyone laughs when I whip it out to use but hey I don't care for the MAC keyboard so anyway LOL
customer_reviews.author: Martina Britt Yelverton

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY!
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY, a wireless keyboard with numeric keys. Delighted with it. I'd recommend getting an app called iStat Menus (for Mac's), that will put a tiny icon on your menubar that gives the battery status of the keyboard and mouse. Mac OS has not been dependable in letting me know when I don't have much battery power left. There is a dark colored version of this keyboard available at the Apple store, which might look better on your desktop, especially if paired with a dark-tone MacBook.
customer_reviews.author: R. B. Basham

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for most types of work, beware of no backlight
customer_reviews.text: For Mac users, this is a very neat and simple keyboard. It uses Apple scissors switches (not the butterfly), they have a nice 1mm of travel, the spacing isn't bad at all. the matte black version does show more fingerprints than it's white counterpart, the lack of backlight is bothering, but I got used to it, and the response time isn't 1ms, but also really good for a Bluetooth keyboard, and it also uses lightning to connect to with a wire. also for bootcamp users, it uses the same connection as the mac does, so you don't need to reconnect it every-time. The battery life is amazing (1 charge per 3 weeks, with 5-7 hours os usage daily).
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Deek

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it's overpriced, however, its really nice to have all the keys match your Macbook
customer_reviews.text: I have another keyboard that is compatible with my laptops, but I prefer this one. as the keys are where I expect them for all of my keyboard shortcuts. Not having to use mental energy to remember where to place my fingers when doing shortcuts is more than worth paying the Apple premium. Also, the battery life is amazing, I use it all day every day for over two weeks before I needed to recharge my mouse, and I thought I'd check my keyboard, and it still had like 30% left. My 3rd party keyboard can last maybe 3 days, so effectively, I had to recharge it every night.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Pettengill

customer_reviews.title: awesome fit, finish, feel
customer_reviews.text: beautiful keyboard that's a pleasure to type on. It's light weight but feels solid. Everything functions perfectly and connected within seconds to my MBP. The foot print is small/compact but you have plenty of room to type. The keyboard angle is comfortable and allows for quick typing with everything within reach. Excellent product - little on the expensive side, but the fit and finish are impeccable.
customer_reviews.author: Overboost

customer_reviews.title: The price of cool is high
customer_reviews.text: I use this with an iMac, so I don't really need the wireless aspect. Purchased because I couldn't find a new wired Apple aluminum keyboard. Did they stop making them?!?! Anyway, I leave the USB lightning cable plugged into the back of the iMac, so my wireless keyboard is wired, now, and always fully charged if I ever to need disconnect and walk around the room with the keyboard while I work.
customer_reviews.author: robk64

customer_reviews.title: Yet another...
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong - I'm a long time Mac user (since the '80s!) and love my iMac Pro, but Apple seems to have forgotten what make a keyboard insanely great: this overstyled, overpriced and underperforming keyboard from Apple with its soft, mushy keys make it unpleasant for work and worthless for gaming, but I guess it looks pretty...
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: I wish the bluetooth connection was faster/easier
customer_reviews.text: This is just what you would expect from an Apple product: - Pricey - High Quality - Style and finish BUT. I wish the connectivity via Bluetooth is sometimes hard. My computer detects my mouse as soon as I turn it on. With this keyboard, I sometimes have to connect the wire for my Mac to detect it. I am running macOS Catalina on a 2017 Macbook Pro. Besides that connectivity issue. It is very good :)
customer_reviews.author: david l.

customer_reviews.title: Need a special cable to pair with new MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this keyboard to pair with a 2019 MacBook Pro. In order to pair it, and to enable Bluetooth use, you need to hook the keyboard to your MacBook. The keyboard comes with a lightning port to a standard USB cable adapter...BUT unfortunately, the new MacBooks don't have a standard USB port...they have only a USB-C port. So, now I have to buy a lightning port to USB-C adapter. <<sigh>> Apple, can't you ever make things EASY???
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clout vs Saving money ?
customer_reviews.text: I believe this is a great keyboard for what is expected from Apple. The design is probably the reason why we buy this keyboard alone, But the elevated keys is barely noticeable, and dust is visible on the keys all the time (since I have the white version) . But overall it’s a nice keyboard with great battery life, the slimness of the keyboard scares me sometimes because i think that if i take it off my desk I’ll break it (probably just me fearing apple’s build). I don’t but if you were to spend $130 USD on a keyboard, I know there are other options to choose from that have better ergonomics.
customer_reviews.author: DressageMama

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best keyboard I've ever worked with. The battery life on it is quite surprising. I have a Logitech solar keyboard that won't hold a charge as long as this keyboard does. I charged it once and a few weeks later and I'm still at 67%. Daily use. The quality is solid. The keys feel smooth and respond properly. This is much better than my Macbook's crappy keyboard (2017 MacBook Pro).
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: 10 months later and numerous keys have failed
customer_reviews.text: I like the keyboard, I appreciate the 10 key, but wow! After only 10 months many keys have failed. Is there an exchange available?
customer_reviews.author: Ken Friedman

customer_reviews.title: Very Slim Style, Reduces Cable Clutter
customer_reviews.text: I've had an Apple wired keyboard with numeric keypad for years and it has served well. My wife demanded I clean up the desk area and get rid of some of the cables. So this seemed like the ideal solution. There are third-party manufacturers, but after living with a smaller Magic Keyboard to go with my iPad, I liked the feel of that and figured best to go this route. True the Apple products are more expensive, but after a month of living with it, I'm pleased with the tactile feel and slim profile. So far, only charged it once.
customer_reviews.author: Bert  Weyl

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED: 4 stars only for one reason...
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED: I was using a brand new Apple Magic Keyboard w/ Numeric Keypad and suddenly the "m" key only worked when pressing it exceedingly hard, warranting the keyboard annoying to use and essentially useless. Amazon and the seller were very helpful and corrected the issue by sending me a new keyboard and allowing for a free return of the broken item. I still love this keyboard, but am hoping there won't be any future issues.
customer_reviews.author: asmz_me

customer_reviews.title: Elegant, Simple, and Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a while now and no issues at all. I did what another reviewer suggested and taped a dowel to the back to raise it a little at an angle--Apple doesn't include fold-out legs or anything to make it sit on your desk at an angle. The charge lasts a long time and is easy to recharge when necessary--just use the USB to plug into your computer. Like all Apple products, it works great right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: mdash

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a wired version of the Apple keyboard, which stopped responding to a vertical of keys after a water spill. I like better the taller keys of the wired keyboard - their deeper, softer travel felt more natural. This one is working well too, just a matter of habit. I do like the bigger row of functional keys. I am using the keyboard for my Windows PC and find it most comfortable option so far (used Sharp Keys to reprogram the option and command keys to function as the window and alt keys on PC, as well as to control volume and other functions with the F13-F19 keys).
customer_reviews.author: Manuil Tonev

customer_reviews.title: broken key after 6months! love the product but not sure about the quality control
customer_reviews.text: after about 6months the "i" does not work probably i would have to press really hard for it to actually work. tried to look up the serial number on apple web page to get help and it doesn't show as valid tried to contact apple support with long phone waits! I give up! hopefully when covid ends I can just walk into the Apple store for help. waste of money should have just order straight from apple not even sure if this is a knock-off
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm a very happy camper with this keyboard!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the magic keyboard, not just to complement my MacBook Pro (especially when I hook it up to the USB-C Hub), but, mainly, to see how it would complement my PC, which I use for work. The minute I hooked up the Magic Keyboard to the USB-C Hub, which I also connect to my PC, it worked perfectly!! And, the best part of this is, there is no need for alkaline batteries--it recharges. In short, I am very happy with my purchase and the fact that it works perfectly for both types of computers.
customer_reviews.author: elisaus

customer_reviews.title: Well Made... suggest a slight modification
customer_reviews.text: Like most Apple products, this Keyboard is made well. As with other reviews, it does need a slight modification to improve the Ergonomics... Nothing a spacer and 2 sided tape won't fix.
customer_reviews.author: HGAZ

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Lasted 3 years and still going.
customer_reviews.text: I've had several for several computers over the past 3 years. They are all still working fine. Nice and comfortable keys to type up. You don't need a sledgehammer or feel carpal tunnel pain for having to exert a huge amount of effort to push them. The softest detachable keyboard I've ever used, and I've tried all the ones I could find at stores.
customer_reviews.author: B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but so much better
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of the 3rd party blue tooth keyboards because it could connect to multiple computers. It didn't work out well. I then bought a USB switcher, and the Apple Magic keyboard. Yeah it's not wireless with this setup, but it works so much better. The feel is great, and I don't get garbage characters showing up in my text like I did with the 3rd party keyboard. So yeah, expensive, but totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Chokobo

customer_reviews.title: (Almost) Perfect Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Like others have mentioned, it would be nice if it had backlighting. But since it's rechargeable, I'm guessing that might cause the battery life to be too short. However, maybe make it backlit only when it's plugged in? Other than that, it's perfect for me, the quality is outstanding and the feel of the keys is just right. A bit expensive, but like a lot of products, you typically get what you pay for. Highly recommended unless you need backlighting.
customer_reviews.author: Oh Yeah

customer_reviews.title: No Batteries!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I don't have to worry about replacing batteries as I had to in my older Apple keyboard. It was a pain. Now I just hook the keyboard up to my desktop usb hub and fuggeddaboudit. It's an expanded keyboard with number pad and fn keys, page down and up, home keys. It's very nice, but it does take some getting used to as far as touch. Early on I kept skipping keys. I'm still working on adapting, but it's getting better
customer_reviews.author: Art Lover

customer_reviews.title: Buy this keyboard!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have this connected to my 16 inch MacBook Pro and that MBP is connected to an LG 43 Inch monitor. This keyboard is amazing! I can’t go back to the keys on the MBP although this iteration is an huge update from the dreaded butterfly keys. The keyboard holds a charge for a very long time however I have it connected via USB on my LG monitor since I use this for trading and cannot afford to risk an inadvertent loss of power.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: So happy!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had spilled coffee all over my apple keyboard. I was dreading having to have a new one shipped from apple and saw that Amazon had it available. I received it within 2 days, just in time to finish my work. Oh goodness, Amazon, you have saved me yet again! It is apple product, not a fake, and works great. Love the feeling of a new keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Makai

customer_reviews.title: Perfect add-on to Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard to use with my 15" MacBook Pro and the Magic Mouse. The keyboard connected to my laptop effortlessly, and love that I don't have to use a USB port. The Bluetooth connectivity of the keyboard and mouse are a game changer in terms of their overall ease of use and how they declutter your desktop (no cables!).
customer_reviews.author: Charlene H

customer_reviews.title: Need an adaptor for newer Macs
customer_reviews.text: I don't get why Apple does that but the keyboard comes with a regular USB cable that is needed to connect for the first time. The newer versions of the Mac don't even have that port anymore (only USB-C) and we need to use an adaptor to connect one of their own products. Luckily I had one, but not really consumer-thinking...
customer_reviews.author: Diego

customer_reviews.title: Apple Magic Keyboard with Numeric Keypad (Wireless, Rechargable) in Silver
customer_reviews.text: I got this keyboard and matching mouse for my son, who just graduated law school, to upgrade his home office. He loves it for a number of reasons, not the least of which is that it's small and lightweight and perfect for his desk. He also likes the 'color' (Silver). It has made studying for the Bar easier, he tells me.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: "apple" keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have just received my package and when I opened the box everything inside was obviously tampered with and thrown everyone disorganized. I opened the peel and saw that the whole thing was covered in hair. it was obviously used.
customer_reviews.author: Doodle Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is a good keyboard and mouse. They both connected easily enough. They both work fine. Like most things Apple, they're way too expensive for what they are. The mouse is a bit too small unless you have tiny hands. And the action on the keyboard is non-existent. I wish Apple made a larger mouse and a quality mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Looks beautiful, but not a fan of the limited key travel
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the aesthetic of this keyboard, but it was really lacking on the key travel and despite the big size the keys just seemed too close together. For the price I was disappointed by the lack of backlighting. I've been using the 3rd Gen A1314 keyboard that came with my 2009 iMac and still love it, just wanted something that matched my 2019 Space Gray MBP. Went back to my old keyboard after a couple days of trying this out and ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: MAC Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this keyboard because the keyboard that came with my Mac was too small and did not have a calculator pad. The keyboard was easy to install and pair with my Mac without any issues. Great value and cheaper that buying one at the Apple Store. However, I think it could have been a little cheaper on the price.
customer_reviews.author: AJ3

customer_reviews.title: Best one to use withMacs
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time with the Logitech Solar 750. Worked great until it didn't. It would just stop working after 12 , 9 or 6 months - I went through 3 different keyboards that Logitech gave me under the warranty. But then I finally gave up and bought this apple Magic keyboard. Wanted the number pad which was not available until after I bought the logitech. I use my MacBook as a clam with a large LED monitor. All work great since I bought this keyboard. Only one truly comparable with Macs. Others have windows keys that do not work with Macs.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive POS. I’ve had to order another brand which I can only hope works better. It drops the connection every few minutes. I bought it in Nov 2019. The Bluetooth is so terrible that I’ve begun using it wired for some stability. My Mac is no more than 2feet away and I’m on the latest Mac Mini with the latest MacOS. Apple should be ashamed to put their name on this.
customer_reviews.author: F. L. Siewert

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard! It’s one of my favorites! I had an older generation magic keyboard and it feels different. I like the space grey because you can’t see the dirt that the white one picks up.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: This is the second Apple MK I've owned. After ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Apple MK I've owned. After the first one stopped working, I tried to make due with the shorter version that came with my desktop and I just couldn't stand not having the numerical keys on the right hand side. I literally had trouble typing on it after being used to this one for so long. As far as the keyboard itself, its what you come to expect from an Apple product, which is top of the line.
customer_reviews.author: Lino412

customer_reviews.title: Paired easily with my iMac
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to pair this keyboard. It is a good design, typical of Apple products. I'm glad to have the 10-key pad again. I've missed that. Also the function keys such as delete, end, page up and down, are easy to access. I'm very happy with the keyboard. I just need to remember to turn it off to save battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne D. Fenimore

customer_reviews.title: Best Apple Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is nothing short of the best keyboard Apple has ever produced! I pound on my keyboards all day, everyday. I was stunned at how long the battery lasts. In fact, I’ve never seen it get low. Months pass by and I finally charge it, only because I can’t really believe it can last that long and retain such a good charge. Get it! You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: David Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Mechanically Awesome, Bluetooth is Glitchy on Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: Really amazing quality keyboard. Keys are perfect as I've come to expect from Apple keyboards. I have it paired to a Windows 10 machine, and sometimes the Bluetooth will be very glitchy. Specifically, about every 10th use, the last key i pressed will repeat until I turn the keyboard off. Then, when I plug in the hard wire, it starts working OK. Could be a Windows problem, or it could be a little of both.
customer_reviews.author: Bada Boom

customer_reviews.title: What's not to likle?
customer_reviews.text: Received my Magic Keyboard, the full keyboard, with numeric keys to the right. Responds well. Paired immediately. The only down side is the way the keyboard lays flat on the desk. Ergonomics were just not considered when designing. Something thatn lifts the top, at an angle would make this a fabulous purchase. Those with "carpal tunnel" may find this uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Heft

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard for PC and Mac
customer_reviews.text: Great product overall. All needed functionality for seamless use on both PC and Mac. Awesome build quality, fits great with all-black decor. I think this is the best keyboard I ever owned (or at least in top 2, second being the Microsoft ergonomic keyboard from 2002, which is too old school for 2020).
customer_reviews.author: Valeriy N.

customer_reviews.title: Invalid Serial Number
customer_reviews.text: The serial number is not valid. Apple Support told me this is a counterfeit product. Because it’s not a genuine Apple device it’s not covered by their warranty. It seems to work fine, but I purchased it under the impression that it was genuine. Apple confirmed that it is not, so I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Abi

customer_reviews.title: Feels just like a macbook keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This makes working on a laptop so much easier! I have my laptop elevated to keep from slouching so i use this keyboard as i would like a desktop. The number pad is very helpful since i use it often. It feels very much like my macbook pro and the buttons have a similar spring (hopefully that makes sense). Totally worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jody E.

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard for iPad Pro
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it on my 2018 iPad Pro and it works great. Makes writing notes, emails, and work overall much easier than using the on screen keyboard. You have more shortcuts than a standard iPad keyboard cover. You can control the sound volume and even the brightness on the iPad from this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: G1

customer_reviews.title: Horrible design and not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the previous Bluetooth version without the number pad, there's a few things that make this a worse choice. CONS: 1. It's essentially a flat keyboard. The back edge is 1/4 inch higher than the front edge. Not comfortable on your wrists for typing. 2. The keys are very low and soft, mushy which causes a lot of accidentally clicked keys and frequent misspelling. The slightest touch causes a keystroke and theres very little tactile feedback to let you know that you pressed a key. This is by far the worst and most annoying feature. A deal breaker in my opinion. PRO: 1. Number pad. I love all Apple products but this one is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: acmd1633

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY TO BE APPLEY
customer_reviews.text: wow this keyboard feels so nice and organic...i feel like i could seamlessly write a book. the pressure of. your fingers feels so amazing.... stop buying those ALMOST MAC KEYBOARDS this is it Y'ALL!!!! HAPPY FACE > HAPPY FACE> I ORDERED IT THIS MORNING AND BY 9PM... I HAD A NEW KEYBOARD.
customer_reviews.author: Ming

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with the keyboard and does exactly what I would expect. It connects quickly and the battery lasts a long time before I have to charge again.
customer_reviews.author: Stormy

customer_reviews.title: What I'd Expect From Apple Of Old
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is crazy. On a single charge, I ran this keyboard wirelessly for weeks and it never dropped below 50%. It seems durable and I've dropped it on hardwoods twice. It held up fine. I like it has an on/off switch to conserve battery life even more, although you might not need it. I'm an author and the keys are super-responsive so on long writing binges, it is quite comfortable. I even type in my lap with it. It takes a little balancing, but once I'm settled, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Ric Beard

customer_reviews.title: Apple quality
customer_reviews.text: Using it right now to write this review. The keyboard is well made and the keys feel really good. I bought this to replace my original wireless Apple keyboard that doesn't have the numeric key section and love it. The old keyboard still works fine and will keep it as a spare. You can find cheaper keyboards but the quality of most of them are not very good. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan  Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard, too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Standard Apple product. Good quality, functions as expected and severely overpriced. If you can afford it, get it, if you can’t I’m sure there are cheaper options that are just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Timber R6

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard if you like short throws
customer_reviews.text: I love the magic keyboard... not a big fan of the deep throw mechanical keyboards that are coming back into style again. I'd say that one out of 20 times that I go to use my keyboard in the morning it's not connected for some reason so I plug it in and it re-pairs instantly. Lame. Looks fly and hell tho
customer_reviews.author: Steve Markgraf

customer_reviews.title: A real disappointment, it's back in its box in a cabinet as a emergency backup.
customer_reviews.text: the key action us unreliable and slow. Certainly not worth the money. there are better bluetooth options. I have been an Apple user since 1978 and have owned most Macintosh models over the years. This keyboard does not live up to Apple's reputation for quality and ease of use. Makes me sad.
customer_reviews.author: Bigguy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Mess Around-Get The Real Thing
customer_reviews.text: Mixed reviews on non-OEM keyboards made this purchase a no-brainer. 4 weeks (50 hrs. + per week) and no low battery warnings, or response lag.
customer_reviews.author: Jon L Bidwell

customer_reviews.title: CAPS-Lock Key Fails to Register
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, you'd think with a regression to an older key switch technology that near problems wouldn't be that much of an issue but maybe i just got a lemon. CAPS-lock key fails to register with moderate to low force. Requires stupid amounts of force to register key stroke. Ordered a replacement. Where is the backlighting on this thing anyway? $140 for a lemon lul. I need that space grey though.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is a bit pricey but after being disappointed with trying other Mac compatible keyboards I decided to go with this one. It has a nice low profile which I prefer and is actually smoother and lighter to the touch than the old Apple keyboard . So worth the price in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: mkmok

product_meta.title: Apple Magic Keyboard with Numeric Keypad (Wireless, Rechargable) (US English) - Silver
feature_bullets: Magic Keyboard with Numeric Keypad features an extended layout, with document navigation controls for quick scrolling and full-size arrow keys for gaming
A scissor mechanism beneath each key allows for increased stability, while optimized key travel and a low profile provide a comfortable and precise typing experience.
The numeric keypad is also great for spreadsheets and finance applications.
